alert.note: Alert for Eastern Black Range Foothills (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Sierra County through 545 PM MDT... At 413 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Rincon, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Caballo, Cuchillo, Truth or Consequences, City of Elephant Butte, Palomas, Rock House, North Monticello Point, Alamosa Canyon, Williamsburg, Elephant Butte Lake, Lower Animas Creek, Upper Palomas Canyon, Lost Canyon, Lower Palomas Canyon, Ash Canyon, Rock Canyon, Hot Springs Landing, Lakeshore Highlands, South Monticello Campground and Caballo Lake. This includes Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 59 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Elephant Buttte Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
